intro: Maackia amurensis, commonly known as the Amur maackia, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its pod fruits and nitrogen-fixing abilities. The plant typically grows to a height of 1–3 meters, featuring compound leaves with pinnate structure. Its flowers are small, clustered in racemes, and often have a distinctive yellow or white color. The bark is smooth and grayish, while the leaves are alternate and ovate in shape.
